alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 12:52AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Santa Cruz County through 130 AM PST... At 1252 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout 7 miles southeast of Santa Cruz, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Cruz, Watsonville, Corralitos, Scotts Valley, Capitola, Live Oak, Aptos, Twin Lakes, Opal Cliffs, Freedom, Eureka Canyon Road, Rio Del Mar, Soquel, Amesti, Interlaken, Aptos Hills-Larkin Valley, Aptos Hills-Larkin and Day Valley. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Cruz Mountains
